iconiser.icon-prefix.name: Icon prefix
iconiser.icon-prefix.hint: Specificy a prefix that is prepended in front of every found icon name. If you have your icons locally, the prefix can be the directory where you stored your icons. If you host your icons online, this can be the hostname of your server/ S3 bucket.
iconiser.replacement-policy.name: Icon replacement policy
iconiser.replacement-policy.hint: Defines if icons should be set automatically
iconiser.icon-database-policy.name: Icon database policy
iconiser.icon-database-policy.hint: Defines which databases should be used when deciding on the new icon. A custom database is a JSON-file in the icon directory named 'icons.json'. See iconiser/data/custom-example.json for an example format. Note: Changing this setting requires a reload.
iconiser.icon-database-policy.1: Use the predefined database and my custom one
iconiser.base-dictionary.name: Base dictionary
iconiser.base-dictionary.hint: Select the base dictionary to use, defaults to a dictionary referencing to the basic Foundry icons. Please note: This is only the dictionary, you will need to add the required icons manually. Note: Changing this setting requires a reload.
iconiser.share-missing-icons.name: Share missing icons
iconiser.share-missing-icons.hint: You can choose to send the item details (name, type and subtype) to the VTTA server. This enables me to find suitable icons for new items more easy.
iconiser.setting.reset.name: Reset settings to default
iconiser.setting.reset.label: Reset Settings To Default
iconiser.setting.reset.hint: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
iconiser.setting.debug.name: Enable debugging
iconiser.setting.debug.label: Prints debug messages to the console
iconiser.dialogs.resetsettings.title: Reset Module Settings
iconiser.dialogs.resetsettings.content: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
